data.content: Ambeon now fully involved and so am I!

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: I.m.o. The CMET project stands out as being the most viable Mineral Sands project in Sri Lanka. Lanka Mineral Sands have all sorts of issues going on and Tit Sands will run into big Env. opposition to their plans even if they get all their Licencing.Iluka bailed long time ago on their project. Anyways; the less news we are getting at present, means the more news will be building up for release simultaneously. https://www.themorning.lk/articles/I5ZUwkxBeWssElKM5orp

data.author: Reserved
data.content: Greg Martyr, Executive Chairman of Capital Metals, commented: "We are very pleased with the final Phase 1 drilling results, which have confirmed not only consistently high heavy mineral grades but also a threefold increase in the surface area of the mineralisation in the initial mining area alone compared to the current resource. This marks a step change for the Project as we advance towards development. The discovery of multiple high-grade palaeo-shorelines at depth further strengthens the long-term potential of the Project. With geo-metallurgical and density studies now underway, we are confident the upcoming resource update will demonstrate the world-class quality of the Project."

data.author: Reserved
data.content: LSE are a bit slow this AM. https://www.londonstockexchange.com/news-article/CMET/3rd-batch-of-drill-assay-results/17230040

data.author: Justone
data.content: LTH have had a bumpy ride with CMET, we are now seeing some real traction in our world class asset. Hopefully the share price will start to respond, I need to triple!

data.author: oldbutnowisa
data.content: ...another winner in my p/f. Just added Scancell but don't blame me if this one bombs!!

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Justone, Yeah looks like a very impressive result so far.  These holes are from the initial mining area and its now increased by around 300% from today's update.  They are still drilling the extension holes.  They're finding minerals sands now as far as 1.1km inland, the resource upgrade is going to be multiples and they're still drilling.  Love Greg's world class description.  Surprised we're only up a little bit today.  I guess some are waiting for the listing in Colombo and for the resource upgrade itself when it comes.  Its certainly primed with potential now, lots of new data to put into the new resource model that's for sure! Regards, Ed.

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Good to see that this RNS has been delivered when they said it would be, bang on time.  for those unfamiliar, the area map highlighted relates to the land just south of Koraikkalappu. also handy to overlay this area using topography map to show sea levels.. https://en-gb.topographic-map.com/map-4d9jnh/The-World/?center=6.73178%2C81.78463&zoom=12

data.author: Chezt
data.content: Interesting that Greg has recently been referring more to development of the mine in recent RNSs i.e. like today with “ This marks a step change for the Project as we advance towards development” rather that saying that we are progressing towards the final investment decision.  It lends a lot more confidence that this project is undoubtedly going ahead, so I am surprised that the share price isnt moving higher than this

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Edgein 4 .9 18:17 also picked up on that same point.  The  hires they have taken on as well means the Co are now having a decent monthly wage bill going out.  I cant see why they would have taken on so many employees unless they were ready to go full steam ahead. perhaps Justone can tease out some more info on staff numbers and positions filled at the agm.. ?

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Scaff. Its certainly heading in the right direction from an operational perspective, hiring the necessary staff as you say and getting in house influence upon the Sri Lankan authorities (mining experience), even local celebrities.  The Colombo listing of the subsidiary is a master stroke to make the company more Sri Lankan.  Wage bill is going up, but also cash is looking strong now too and by all accounts FID seems to have been reached with the preparation of the final funding and construction due to start within months.  We could be seeing production late next year and then be self funding.  The upcoming resource upgrade will help get the story out there too. Regards, Ed.

data.author: Adam1986
data.content: Significant progress  appears to finally be being made here now. FID still on track for year end. NPV raised. Coming together nicely.

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Well guys and gals FID has reappeared again!  Good progress being made right across the project, all sounds very professional with lots of community engagement.  New expanded IMA due to the ongoing drill results and have applied for an additional ML.  Lots of work done on the logistics and hydrogeology, I guess some of that is to aid the dredging plans in the future.  Improved financials all look good.  Was listening to a Sheffield resources presentation yesterday and they also export ilmenite and zircon concentrates to China (from Australia), so a similar set up planned here.  Phase 1 for us will be an all in one concentrate.  Sounds like progress being made on all fronts and still hoping to get FID done this year, Sheffield's presentation suggested high demand for these commodities so the offtake pricing etc could be interesting.  Good that the company want to maintain momentum and will be interesting to hear the presentation next week. Regards, Ed.

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Very appropriate header title-!  This is exactly what we were hoping to get.  A lot of questions answered here incl. shipping to Colombo. Its a well drawn out and detailed Management plan.

data.author: Withoutaclue
data.content: Latest interview by GM https://youtu.be/qKnmZIiDMN4?si=6MwH41ZDIBmLsRrC

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Wac, Thanks for posting that new interview link, lots going on with the final stages from the sounds of it.  The bank funding sounds interesting as do the comments on the reduced capex.  60km strike length!  30+ years LoM, no wonder Greg has started to describe it as world class. Regards, Ed.

data.author: Justone
data.content: A very good interview. I am off to the AGM tomorrow, to press the flesh, look into the eyes and assess how buoyant they are. I will also want to get words of comfort that we as PI’s are going to be looked after. We have waited many years to get to this stage,  we have missed out on a lot of other opportunities whilst invested in this potential. I want a return, and need over twice to break even! I will give shareholders my opinion tomorrow.

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Justone, Will be interesting to hear your views from the AGM.  Was just in the investormeets with Greg this morning, hope you made it to that too!  Was an interesting discussion for sure.  Sounds like the upgraded MRE could be out around the end of the month.  Ambeon are helping on a number of fronts with the government which is certainly a positive that they are an active shareholder.  Greg comes across as professional, thoroughly ticking off the boxes and working closely with the community.  They'll be continuously doing phased as the project progresses so it all sounds really positive.  Like the last update suggested they've debt and equity proposals for full funding.  May accelerate the development after 6 months of production, also his comments on the development of the deeper resource sound interesting too as the country wants to establish the value of its various mineral resources. Regards, Ed.

data.author: Edgein
data.content: *Upgraded MRE suggested end of next month rather than this month*

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: The comment on Lanka Minerals would tie in very much with my own opinion on how things could develop down the line.  It would be good to get this dredging /EIA sorted as I feel once that hurdle is crossed we are truly off. otherwise all looking good.

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Scaff, Yeah interesting comments regarding Lanka minerals too.  Be interesting to see what the share price does on the upgraded MRE now that the cuff-off is lowered to 2% as well as all those 600 deeper holes.  Dredging permission would also be very positive and it sounds like they're working towards that too. Regards, Ed.

data.author: SidR
data.content: After the presentation I do finally feel a bit more confident that this might actually go into production one day, especially with Ambeon no doubt having an 'old boy' network including senior gov officials. Outstanding concerns for me are 1) not yet having clearance to export concentrate (currently not permitted) 2) still restricted to above water table mining 3) driving container trucks 8hrs to Colombo (I know those roads from past holidays in Arugam Bay!). Hope they can sort those out before FID.

data.author: Justone
data.content: I was the only shareholder! They gave me all the time I wanted in front of the full team of advisers, an hour, ask me anything you want, no holds barred.  I came away full of confidence. This is going to happen, with all the component parts in place. They have aspirations to not be a one trick pony, so have ambitions beyond the current project. Right project at the right time within a country that is changing, and is seeking global recognition as a place to invest. Smacks of opportunity. Funding is about choice, huge resource upgrades. It has been a long hard road, having been in since the palm oil, having accumulated all the way down. This time next year, the share price will reflect the reality. The only negative was the soft prices for our product, but given that we are a year away from producing, no great issue. Let’s hope we have a bull run in commodity prices, it is about time, the world woke up to real physical assets as a source of value.

data.author: Adam1986
data.content: Justone, thanks for sharing that. Today’s Q&A/ AGM has certainly convinced a few. The buying today is probably the highest I’ve seen here in one day. It’s hard to believe we’re only up 5%. I’m so glad I stuck it out when it went tits up with Sheffield. I’ve got some way to go to break even but I strongly believe it’s when and not if.

data.author: jonny_five
data.content: Blimey just noticed all those  big round buys. Someone is loading up for sure. There does seem to be alot of momentum building now as each announcement makes the company more credible and the project more of a reality. Should be a good six months coming up. 5p surely a certainty in the very short term and double digits when funding is finalised and resource updated. Then who knows....

data.author: Andoman99
data.content: Im still here, been quiet.....just watching.....its all looking good.

data.author: Justone
data.content: It is good Andoman99, judging from the mood at the AGM. We have a lot of potential, way beyond the current project within country. Exciting times. Our market value, does not reflect the potential which is frustrating, but that is the AIM market. We just have to be patient, and let the value be revealed. We will have our day in the sun I am sure. The team sounded confident anyway!

data.author: Edgein
data.content: Justone, Cheers for your comments and feedback from the AGM.  We should have a very action packed Q4 with the resource upgrade, ML, permissions and funding all due next Q.  We might even have more drill results in the coming Q too.  Now that the company is sitting on around $5.5m in cash the continuous drilling should help sustain our momentum.  I'm certainly looking forward to see what the MRE upgrade does to our already large NPV. Regards, Ed.

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Yes Justone I'm echoing others comments on your attendance.. The lack of shareholders at agm is a mirror of this bb currently but the crowd will turn up just as they do to a pub before closing time,noisy as hell and all trying to get in at the same time.

data.author: Justone
data.content: I complimented Greg, that the reason why there was no one at the AGM was that he was communicating with shareholders so well! They didn’t feel the need to attend, as things were moving forward. In my case, I had put too much of the family money in! I now feel that it was the right decision! Risky yes, but the return should reflect the risk as we move forward. It was interesting, I asked Greg what percentage of the shareholders did he know. The answer was 60%. The company is not going to get whisked away from us, without giving us shareholders the value of the potential! This was confirmed by Greg, management are aligned with shareholders, and I looked into their eyes when I asked that! I am a cynic when it comes to directors on aim, but I do believe in this case that they will be fair. Any offer for the company would  have to be consensual, but as we move forward with the size of our resource, we might be on someone’s radar.

I also believe for the 2nd $2 million investment took longer as they wanted make sure everything adds up properly before put their money. It's a long and painful wait but I believe a lot will happen over the next 3 months and share price will be very different to today's price in the next 3 months. Good luck 👍

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Post From Stuart Forrester Linked in today   very positive vibes emanating from Sri Lanka gov minister. "It was great to hear the speech last week of Hon. Sunil Handunneththi MP, Sri Lanka’s Minister of Industry & Entrepreneurship Development, as the country’s Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) came under his Ministry's purview. Some key highlights from the minister’s address: “As the Minister of Industries, based on my experience over the past year, I am committed to advancing the industrial sector - particularly the mineral resources industry - to strengthen the national economy, enhance export earnings, and foster innovation.” “Sri Lanka must attract genuine investors with the capacity to bring meaningful and sustainable investment to the country. The global market possesses many such stakeholders, and it is essential to identify and engage them appropriately.” “Our ultimate aim is to ensure that the nation’s mineral wealth is developed sustainably, protected environmentally, and preserved responsibly for the benefit of future generations.” “The first step towards achieving this goal is to secure Parliamentary approval for the National Mineral Policy and to ensure that it is well communicated both nationally and internationally.” We’re delighted with the positive actions being taken by the government which is finalising its new National Minerals Policy, demonstrating the country is now open for business in the minerals sector."

data.title: Holding in Company
data.full_content:
28 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 7023Q
Capital Metals PLC
28 January 2026
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE UK VERSION OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION NO 596/2014 WHICH IS PART OF ENGLISH LAW BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018, AS AMENDED. ON PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT VIA A REGULATORY INFORMATION SERVICE, THIS INFORMATION IS CONSIDERED TO BE IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
28 January 2026
Capital Metals PLC
("Capital Metals" or the "Company")
Holding in Company
Capital Metals (AIM: CMET), a mineral sands company approaching mine development stage at its high-grade Taprobane Minerals Project in Sri Lanka (the "Project"), announces that Sheffield Resources Limited (ASX: SFX) ("Sheffield") has on 27 January 2026 sold the 49,173,418 shares it held in Capital Metals and no longer holds an interest in the Company. Capital Metals is pleased to note that Sheffield's entire shareholding (approximately 10% of the issued share capital) was placed out with new institutional and high net worth investors including existing shareholders and associates of Ambeon Capital PLC in Sri Lanka, the Company's largest shareholder (owning 12.1% of the issued share capital).
Greg Martyr, Executive Chairman of Capital Metals, commented:
"We appreciate the support of Sheffield as a strategic investor, including several follow-on investments as recently as September 2025 to maintain its shareholding. We understand the context in which Sheffield has sold its position, given the well-publicised working capital challenges in relation to its Thunderbird Mineral Sands Mine in Western Australia. Demand from other high-quality investors, including Sri Lankans, has enabled Sheffield's holding to be fully transferred."
For further information,
please visit
www.capitalmetals.com
or contact:
Capital Metals plc
Greg Martyr (Executive Chairman)
Via Vigo Consulting
Vigo Consulting (Investor Relations)
Ben Simons / Peter Jacob
+44 (0)20 7390 0234
capitalmetals@vigoconsulting.com
Strand Hanson Limited (Nominated Adviser)
Ritchie Balmer / Christopher Raggett / David Asquith
+44 (0) 20 7409 3494
Hannam & Partners (Broker & Financial Adviser)
Andrew Chubb / Leif Powis
+44 (0)20 7907 8500
About Capital Metals
Capital Metals is a UK company listed on the London Stock Exchange (AIM: CMET). We are developing the Taprobane Minerals Project in Sri Lanka, approximately 220km east of Colombo, containing industrial minerals including ilmenite, rutile, zircon, and garnet. The Project is one of the highest-grade mineral sands projects globally, with potential for further grade and resource expansion. In 2022, a third-party Preliminary Economic Assessment provided a Project NPV of US$155-235m based on existing resources, with further identified optimisation potential. We are committed to applying modern mining practices and bringing significant positive benefits to Sri Lanka and the local community. We expect over 300 direct new jobs to be created and over US$150m in direct government royalties and taxes to be paid.
Visit our website:
www.capitalmetals.com
Follow us on social media:
X:
@MetalsCapital
LinkedIn:
@Capital Metals plc
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. data.title: Holding in Company & Directorate Change
data.full_content:
6 Feb 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 9484R
Capital Metals PLC
06 February 2026
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE UK VERSION OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION NO 596/2014 WHICH IS PART OF ENGLISH LAW BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018, AS AMENDED. ON PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT VIA A REGULATORY INFORMATION SERVICE, THIS INFORMATION IS CONSIDERED TO BE IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
6 February 2026
Capital Metals PLC
("Capital Metals" or the "Company")
Holding in Company&Directorate Change
Further to the announcement on 28 January 2026, Capital Metals (AIM: CMET), a mineral sands company approaching mine development stage at its high-grade Taprobane Minerals Project in Sri Lanka (the "Project"), has now received the following TR1 Form confirming that Sheffield Resources Limited (ASX: SFX) ("Sheffield") no longer has a shareholding in the Company.
Pursuant to the terms of Sheffield's investment in the Company, Sheffield is no longer entitled to appoint a nominee director to the board of the Company. Accordingly, Bruce Griffin has resigned as a Non-Executive Director of Capital Metals with immediate effect. Capital Metals thanks Bruce for his valuable input to date and wishes him well in his other businesses.

data.author: Withoutaclue
data.content: " Capital Metals (CMET), a mineral sands company approaching mine development stage at its high-grade Taprobane Minerals Project in Sri Lanka, has now received the following TR1 Form confirming that Sheffield Resources Limited (ASX: SFX)  no longer has a shareholding in the Company. Pursuant to the terms of Sheffield’s investment in the Company, Sheffield is no longer entitled to appoint a nominee director to the board of the Company. Accordingly, Bruce Griffin has resigned as a Non-Executive Director of Capital Metals with immediate effect. Comment: This is something of a red herring announcement from CMET, given that the market and Sri Lanka has been and should be buzzing like a be regarding its prospects. Indeed, if more people appreciate mineral sands, the shares would on that basis alone be far higher than they already are"

data.content: Key points for me: - securing dredging permission will increase available resource and reduce costs of extraction by 2/3. - adequately financed to the end of Q1 26. - new government seem to be supportive of industrial development - need to secure one more mining licence to progress - disappointed that FID delayed, even though GM stated that they can start construction as planned in Q1 26 - I don't want them to be distracted by other projects - issues affecting Sheffield could have an adverse effect - potential value continues to be attractive, tempered by potential delays.

data.author: Reserved
data.content: Key points for me: - securing dredging permission will increase available resource and reduce costs of extraction by 2/3. - adequately financed to the end of Q1 26. - new government seem to be supportive of industrial development - need to secure one more mining licence to progress - disappointed that FID delayed, even though GM stated that they can start construction as planned in Q1 26 - I don't want them to be distracted by other projects - issues affecting Sheffield could have an adverse effect - potential value continues to be attractive, tempered by potential delays.

data.author: Scaffman
data.content: Either way i'm looking at it as a positive for CMET there is a fair possibility that TS have their licence suspended. reason : local opposition. the wind turbines have been suspended in Nov by Gov due to protests. There is equally strong opposition to the sand mining at mannar. If TS dont get the go ahead then apart from Lanka Min. there is only CMET as a player in producing badly needed revenue and jobs from sand mining for the Gov. On the other hand if TS gets Lic approval then it augers very well for CMET. It shows despite protests that the gov are really determined to get Mining going and as CMET have engaged positively socially and have good relations on the ground with locals there is little opposition to holding the project back. https://www.rvasia.org/asian-news/sri-lanka-protest-protect-mannar-environment-reaches-100th-day#:~:text=As%20a%20result%20of%20the ,that%20had%20triggered%20public%20opposition. https://capitalmetals.com/careers/#:~:text=Interested%20in%20working%20for%20Capital ,Lanka%20(Pvt)%20Ltd%20(Ampara%20District%2Dbased)
